# Highlights

* Environmental audits were conducted along six inferred cycling routes in Hamilton.

* Cyclists' perceptions of the routes were explored in semi-structured interviews.

* Qualitative data can help to understand which objective measures influence cycling.

* Cyclists' perceptions should be regularly explored and incorporated in route design.

* Developing cycling cities should pay attention to factors beyond infrastructure.
